intro: Knautia tomentella, commonly known as the woolly knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It blooms from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
